oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Solution of a low-frequency coupled electromagnetic problem using the wavelet-Galerkin method
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KAUSHIK, K
KULKARNI, SV
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: compactly supported wavelets
partial-differential equations
finite-element
numerical-solution
fields
computational electromagnetics
wavelet-galerkin method
2d analysis
coupled-circuit analysis
wavelet bases
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this paper, we present an analysis of a two-dimensional electric circuit-electromagnetic field coupled problem using the wavelet-Galerkin method. For illustration, the bar-plate configuration, a basic model for analysing eddy current phenomenon in electrical apparatus, is chosen. Firstly, a brief description of wavelet theory and its application in computational electromagnetics is provided. Then, a description of the two-dimensional coupled problem formulation and its solution using the wavelet-Galerkin method is given. Finally, results obtained using simulation are presented.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF APPLIED ELECTROMAGNETICS AND MECHANICS, 34(1-2), 1-19
